DOC.brief_summary: The overarching goal of this study is to characterize the effects of ethanol and cannabinoids on simulated driving and related cognition.
DOC.brief_title: Ethanol and Cannabinoid Effects on Simulated Driving and Related Cognition: Sub-Study II
DOC.detailed_description: To study the effects of oral ethanol (target BAC of ~0.04g/dl; equivalent to consuming approximately 2 drinks over 1 hour) and vaporized cannabis (~450 mg cannabis plant material at a THC concentration of ~1.7%; roughly equivalent to smoking approximately 1/4 of a marijuana cigarette, or "joint") on driving.
DOC.criteria: Males or females 21 to 55 years of age (extremes included). Occasional current cannabis users. Experience with drinking 2 or more standard drinks of alcohol at least once in lifetime. Able to provide informed consent. Cannabis naïve. Alcohol naïve. Positive pregnancy screen Hearing deficits.
